title: Uber appoints new CFO as its AV plans accelerate
summary: Uber is promoting Balaji Krishnamurthy, its VP of strategic finance and investor relations, to be its CFO, replacing its current finance chief Prashanth Mahendra-Rajah.

title: SNAK Venture Partners raises $50M fund to back vertical marketplaces
summary: SNAK Venture Partners announced Wednesday the close of its oversubsubscribed $50 million debut fund, anchored by Pritzker Group.

title: Alexa+, Amazon’s AI assistant, is now available to everyone in the U.S.
summary: Amazon opens Alexa+ to everyone in the U.S. The AI feature is free for Prime members across devices, and free for everyone on mobile and web.

title: Apeiron Labs gets $29M to flood the oceans with autonomous underwater robots
summary: Most of what we know about the ocean just skims the surface, literally. We’ve gathered a large quantity of data on the oceans from satellites, but most of that is based on the top layer of water. Below that, the picture gets murkier. Buoys, ships, and some autonomous rovers have recently added some detail, but […]

title: Accel doubles down on Fibr AI as agents turn static websites into one-to-one experiences
summary: Fibr AI replaces marketing agency– and engineering-heavy website personalization with autonomous systems designed for enterprise scale.

title: Spotify upgrades its lyrics feature with offline access, more translations
summary: Spotify is revamping its lyrics feature, adding offline access for Premium users, global lyric translations, and a more prominent placement in the Now Playing view.

title: Exclusive: Positron raises $230M Series B to take on Nvidia’s AI chips
summary: The investment comes from backers including the Qatar Investment Authority as demand for chips beyond Nvidia soars and as Qatar aims to build out its AI infrastructure.

title: Epstein-linked longevity guru Peter Attia leaves David Protein, and his own startup ‘won’t comment’
summary: Attia co-founded longevity medical testing startup Biograph, which came out of stealth a year ago.

title: India’s Varaha bags $20M to scale carbon removal from the Global South
summary: Varaha's fresh funding is part of a $45 million Series B round led by WestBridge Capital.

title: The Minneapolis tech community holds strong during ‘tense and difficult time’
summary: Founders and investors in the Minneapolis tech industry told TechCrunch they've put much of their work on hold to help out their community.

title: Intel will start making GPUs, a market dominated by Nvidia
summary: Intel has been bulking up a team to focus on this effort and will develop its GPU strategy around customer needs.

title: YC startups can now receive investment in stablecoin
summary: All startups accepted into YC will soon have the option to receive their seed checks via stablecoins.

title: 2026 plans: What’s next for Startup Battlefield 200
summary: See what to expect for Startup Battlefield 200 in 2026, the ultimate startup pitch competition on the global stage at TechCrunch Disrupt. Join the mailing list to be the first to know when applications drop.

title: Homeland Security is trying to force tech companies to hand over data about Trump critics
summary: The use of administrative subpoenas, which are not subject to judicial oversight, are used to demand a wealth of information from tech companies, including the owners of anonymous online accounts documenting ICE operations.

title: Skyryse lands another $300M to make flying, even helicopters, simple and safe
summary: Skyrsye, now valued at $1.15 billion, is pushing to get FAA certification for its universal operating system for flight.

title: Xcode moves into agentic coding with deeper OpenAI and Anthropic integrations
summary: Xcode 26.3 offers agentic coding capabilities with Anthropic's Claude Agent and OpenAI's Codex.

title: Gradient’s heat pumps get new smarts to enable old-building retrofits
summary: Gradient's heat pumps fit in windows, minimizing installation times. Now, it is introducing software to make those units more intelligent.

title: Watch Club is producing short video dramas and building a social network around them
summary: Watch Club will house microdramas and fan discussions in the same app, creating a fandom-focused social media experience.

title: Lotus Health nabs $35M for AI doctor that sees patients for free
summary: This AI doctor is licensed in all 50 states, the startup says. The deal was led by CRV and Kleiner Perkins.

title: French police search X office in Paris, summon Elon Musk for questioning
summary: The Paris prosecutor’s office announced that it is expanding a criminal investigation into X for alleged crimes, including the possession and distribution of child sexual exploitation material.

title: Spotify launches offline lyrics, translations, and lyric previews
summary: On Wednesday, Spotify announced a few new lyrics features aiming to make it easier to understand and access song lyrics, including translations, previews, and offline lyrics. Lyric translations were originally introduced in 2022, but have only been available in specific markets so far. Now, they're rolling out worldwide to both free and premium Spotify users, […]

title: Amazon rolls out Alexa Plus nationwide and launches a new free tier
summary: Amazon has announced that its generative AI-powered digital assistant Alexa Plus is now available to all Prime members in the US via any Alexa-enabled device, Alexa.com, and the Alexa mobile app. If you don't have Prime, you can access the assistant on a new free tier on the web and app, or pay $20 a […]

title: Anthropic says ‘Claude will remain ad-free,’ unlike ChatGPT

title: Sen. Warren wants to know what Google Gemini’s built-in checkout means for user privacy
summary: Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA) is pressing Google for more information about its plans to build a checkout feature into its Gemini AI chatbot. title: Adobe actually won’t discontinue Animate
summary: Adobe is no longer planning to discontinue Adobe Animate on March 1st. title: Republicans haul Netflix before Congress for being too ‘woke’
